DOC.detailed_description: Obesity prevalent military personnel raise concern related health , readiness , national defense . Adverse health consequence obesity place military personnel risk serious medical problem service upon discharge/retirement . Additionally , failure `` make weight '' may negatively impact one 's military career lead discharge service . Early identification personnel risk implementation prevention strategy critical address problem overweight military essential maintain fit fight force . The goal study test effectiveness dissonance-based , weight-gain prevention program ( Fit4Duty ) prevent excess weight gain among service member risk obesity due personal and/or family history overweight . The Fit4Duty program adaptation military exist civilian obesity prevention program , Project Health . The program utilize dissonance base , participant-driven group counsel address excess consumption unhealthy food sedentary behavior . Active duty service member randomize Fit4Duty weight gain prevention program Nutrition Education comparison condition . Participants complete height , weight , body composition measurement , self-report instrument baseline , immediately follow prevention program ( 6-weeks ) , one two year follow-ups . It hypothesize Project Fit4Duty result significantly great reduction risk increase BMI percentile percent fat mass , risk onset overweight obesity 2-year follow-up relative nutrition education control program . If successful , Project Fit4Duty would offer economical approach widespread obesity prevention U.S. Military .
